info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 27 at 6:30PM EDT until August 27 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL CABARRUS...EAST CENTRAL MECKLENBURG AND NORTH CENTRAL UNION COUNTIES... At 630 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles south of Downtown Concord, or 4 miles east of Harrisburg, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Downtown Concord, East Charlotte, West Concord, Mint Hill, Harrisburg, University City, Reedy Creek Park, Charlotte Motor Speedway, Midland and Fairview In Union County. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
